get.summary: Search for assets
get.description:
Search for assets in the database. This is the primary search function and performs the visual search of your
assets.

parameters.name: query

schema.title: Search query
schema.description: The query to search for. If not provided, all assets will be returned.

parameters.description: The query to search for. If not provided, all assets will be returned.

parameters.name: collection_ids[]

schema.title: Collection Ids
schema.description: The collection ids to search in. If not provided, all collection ids will be searched.

parameters.description: The collection ids to search in. If not provided, all collection ids will be searched.

parameters.name: projects[]

schema.title: Project
schema.description: The project to search in. If not provided, all projects will be searched.

parameters.description: The project to search in. If not provided, all projects will be searched.

parameters.name: people[]

schema.title: People
schema.description: The people to search for. If not provided, all people will be searched.

parameters.description: The people to search for. If not provided, all people will be searched.

parameters.name: file_types[]

schema.title: File types
schema.description: The file types to search for. If not provided, all file types will be searched.

parameters.description: The file types to search for. If not provided, all file types will be searched.

parameters.name: file_extensions[]

schema.title: File extensions
schema.description: The file extensions to search for. If not provided, all file extensions will be searched.

parameters.description: The file extensions to search for. If not provided, all file extensions will be searched.

parameters.name: tags[]

schema.title: Tags
schema.description: The tags to search for. If not provided, all tags will be searched.

parameters.description: The tags to search for. If not provided, all tags will be searched.

parameters.name: resolutions[]

schema.title: Resolution
schema.description: The resolution to search for, in the format WxH (e.g. 1920x1080). If not provided, all resolutions will be searched.

parameters.description: The resolution to search for, in the format WxH (e.g. 1920x1080). If not provided, all resolutions will be searched.

parameters.name: limit

schema.title: Limit
schema.description: The maximum number of assets to return. Defaults to 100.

parameters.description: The maximum number of assets to return. Defaults to 100.

parameters.name: page

schema.title: Page
schema.description: The page of results to return. Defaults to 0.

parameters.description: The page of results to return. Defaults to 0.

parameters.name: color

schema.title: Color
schema.description: The color to search for. Cannot be used with the `query` parameter.

parameters.description: The color to search for. Cannot be used with the `query` parameter.

parameters.name: asset_rating

schema.title: Asset Rating
schema.description: The asset rating to filter for.

parameters.description: The asset rating to filter for.

parameters.name: folder

schema.title: Folder
schema.description: The folder to filter for.

parameters.description: The folder to filter for.

parameters.name: recursive

schema.title: Recursive
schema.description: True to recursively search folder

parameters.description: True to recursively search folder

parameters.name: filter_ai

schema.title: Filter to Only Search AI Indexed
schema.description: Filter to only search assets that have been indexed with AI

parameters.description: Filter to only search assets that have been indexed with AI

parameters.name: categories[]

schema.title: Categories
schema.description: The categories to search and filter on

parameters.description: The categories to search and filter on

parameters.name: keys[]

schema.title: Audio keys
schema.description: The audio keys to search for (C, C#, etc). If not provided, all keys will be searched.

parameters.description: The audio keys to search for (C, C#, etc). If not provided, all keys will be searched.

parameters.name: audio_types[]

schema.title: Audio types
schema.description: The audio types (one-shots and loops) to filter on

parameters.description: The audio types (one-shots and loops) to filter on

parameters.name: bpm[]

schema.title: Audio BPM
schema.description: Exact match on one BPM or range if two numbers are given

parameters.description: Exact match on one BPM or range if two numbers are given

parameters.name: date_added[]

schema.title: Date added
schema.description: List of two dates between which we return the assets

parameters.description: List of two dates between which we return the assets

parameters.name: sort

schema.title: Sort order
schema.description: A field name, optionally prefixed by the - sign to specify a descending order.

parameters.description: A field name, optionally prefixed by the - sign to specify a descending order.

parameters.name: use_pca

schema.title: Use PCA Embeddings
schema.description: Used on the discover page to group assets by embeddings.

parameters.description: Used on the discover page to group assets by embeddings.

parameters.name: exclude_file_types[]

schema.title: File types to exclude
schema.description: Used by pages that want to exclude certain types of assets

parameters.description: Used by pages that want to exclude certain types of assets

parameters.name: candid

schema.title: Whether to use candid or not
schema.description: Whether to use candid or not

parameters.description: Whether to use candid or not

schema.title: Whether to use red eye or not
schema.description: Whether to use red eye or not

parameters.description: Whether to use red eye or not

schema.description: Whether to use faces present or not

schema.description: Whether to use people posing or not

get.summary: Request to get the corresponding asset for a given file
get.description:
Get an asset from the index. This will return all data about that file as well as the id. This function can be
useful for looking up the shade id for a file given an input file path. The primary difference between this
route and the GET /assets/asset_id is that this runs with only the path. This is useful for looking up the Shade
id for a file given an input file path.

parameters.name: path

schema.title: The file path
schema.description: The path to the file to lookup

parameters.description: The path to the file to lookup

post.summary: Request the generation of a preview at this path

schema.title: The file path to create preview
